creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: two women walking on rainy street, both carrying umbrellas; woman in front wears an orange kimono and carries a bundle wrapped in red cloth; woman in back wears purple and white jacket and green kimono with black and white scrolls; three men inside porch at left
inscription: left: 自刻　昭和十五年作　雨傘 {Jikoku, Shōwa jūgonen saku, [?????]} | bottom, in grey: Umbrella | in pencil: Toshi Yoshida
markings: LLC, red artist\'s seal: 吉田 {Yoshida}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Umbrella
